intro: Cancrinia pjataevae, commonly known as the Pjataev's cancrinia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant has a distinctive appearance with finely divided, feathery leaves and small white to greenish flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cancrinia pjataevae is considered a vulnerable species.
